cyclone.name: BERYL
cyclone.current_location: about 550 miles ESE of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest toward the Lesser Antilles, then expected to pass south of the U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico into the eastern Caribbean Sea
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Dominica/Guadeloupe in the Lesser Antilles

weather_observation.within_uncertainty_cone: No (San Juan lies just north of the cone’s northern edge)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from Barbados northward to St. Maarten, including St. Lucia, Martinique, St. Martin, St. Barthelemy, Saba and St. Eustatius
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning for Dominica and Guadeloupe
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Lesser Antilles from Barbados through Guadeloupe; system then moves south of the U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Low (only a 3 % chance of sustained 34-kt winds; breezy conditions possible Monday)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; track stays well south of Puerto Rico
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Monday with locally higher pockets
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and rip currents along south-facing coasts beginning late Sunday night into Monday
